Key Match Events: India beat Bangladesh by seven wickets in Gwalior to take a 1-0 lead in the three-match series.
Arshdeep Singh was named PLAYER OF THE MATCH for his brilliant bowling spell.
Arshdeep Singh and Varun Chakravarthy were the pick of the bowlers for India with three wickets each.
Debutant Mayank Yadav performed well and got one wicket.
Hardik Pandya finished the game with a six, scoring 39 off 16 balls.
India chased down the target with more than 8 overs to spare.
Post-Match Reflections: Arshdeep Singh mentioned that he was happy with his performance and highlighted the importance of adapting to situations.
Suryakumar Yadav appreciated the character and selflessness shown by the team and praised the debutants Mayank and Nitish.
Najmul Hossain Shanto reflected on Bangladesh's poor start and the need to adjust according to the situation.
Varun Chakaravarthy expressed his joy at returning to the Indian team after 3 years and emphasized sticking to the process.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at the new stadium in Gwalior.
India's bowlers restricted Bangladesh to a below-par total of 127 runs.
Bangladesh's Mehidy Hasan played well for his unbeaten 35.
Rishad Hossain bowled well for Bangladesh despite not taking a wicket.
